breathe
breathe verb
(AIR)
B1 [ I or T ] to move air into and out of the lungs: It's so airless in here - I can hardly breathe. The instructor told us to breathe in deeply and then breathe out slowly. I'm sorry if I'm breathing (= blowing out air containing) garlic fumes all over you!
More examplesFewer examplesWhen you breathe out, you expel air from your lungs.The atmosphere in the room was so stuffy I could hardly breathe.The firefighters wore respirators to help them breathe in the smoke-filled house.The doctors are doing all that they can, but she's still not breathing properly.I breathed in the crisp mountain air deeply.
